author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to list data that has been transferred across networks or systems. This includes implementing mechanisms to track and catalog data transfers, ensuring that all transferred data can be accounted for and monitored. It is essential for maintaining data integrity, compliance with regulations, and enhancing overall security posture by providing visibility into data movement within the organization.

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.
Network monitoring tools and access to network infrastructure for analysis and control.

title: Establish Ability to List Data Transferred

references.name: NIST SP 800-34 Rev. 1: Contingency Planning Guide for Federal Information Systems
SANS: Data Backup and Recovery Best Practices
CISA Data Backup Options and Strategies
